We asked Mrs Filipi to tell us about the PJ Varsity club’s participation in the Special Olympic’s Polar Bear Plunge today:

The Port Jefferson MS/HS PTSA would like to share the following message from Superintendent of Schools Dr. Paul Casciano:

"This is Superintendent Paul Casciano with information about an important hearing that will be taking place this week which may have serious implications for the Port Jefferson School District.

This Wednesday, March 22nd, the New York State Public Service Commission will be holding public statement hearings at Port Jefferson Village Hall about National Grid's petition to eliminate restrictions that limit energy production from its Port Jefferson facility. The hearings will take place at 1 PM and again at 6 PM.

Given the serious concerns about LIPA’s potential impact on the economy of our school district, I am encouraging you to consider attending the hearings at Village Hall. Comments can be made either orally or in writing.

Additional information about the hearing is available on our district website under Announcements.

Thank you for your consideration.

Information about the case can be obtained at:

www.dps.ny.gov case number (17-E-0057)"

Hello! We hope you all had a wonderful Thanksgiving! The PTSA is starting its Kidstuff coupon book fundraiser in the MS this week. For those of you unfamiliar with this fundraiser, you pay $25 for a copy of a Long Island based coupon book and half of the cost goes to the PTSA. Many of the coupons are good for 16 months and you only have to use a few to make up the $25 cost.

While we're distributing the books in the MS only, as books are returned to the school, we'd like to make them available to families in the ES and HS. It's our understanding that there will not be a Kidstuff coupon book fundraiser in the ES this year. If you'd like to purchase a book, but do not have a child in the MS, please let us know and we will keep a list. First come, first served!

Thanks in advance for your support!!
